intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: And just like that...we're back in Nohr. Amazing...

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Yeah. Did all that stuff with the Rainbow Sage actually happen? Or was it a dream?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: It was no dream, Brother. The wisdom he imparted to us was real. I've never been more ready to take on King Garon!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Let's not forget his other practical words of advice... Nohr's army passed through this area looking for us. So we should head in the opposite direction right away!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Right. Our best bet is to head northeast. There's a direct route that will take us very close to the royal castle. And remember...we may have evaded their forces for now... But we can't let our guard drop, even for a moment.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Understood.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That's quite a fort. Are we going through it, Ryoma?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Yes. It's the fastest way to get to the royal castle. And if we encounter resistance, the enclosed space will actually favor us. We can't be surrounded by a large army in there.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Sounds like a solid strategy to me. I'm fascinated by the structure...I can't wait to see the inside.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: As am I. The fort itself was built partially from the remains of a dragon!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: So that's why it's called Fort Dragonfall...

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Yes. You look upon the carcass of an ancient, legendary beast. Its bones and carcass never seemed to deteriorate, even in death. Eventually, someone got the idea to incorporate them into this fort. In any case, it appears completely unguarded at the moment. Let's move forward.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You heard him!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You would think the Nohrian army would have left SOMEONE behind, right? Yet again, it seems they've just left a major facility abandoned...

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: You're right. I'd definitely rather have discovered a token resistance. This doesn't feel right...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Whoa...what was that?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: I don't know! It could have been an earthquake... We should evacuate for the time being.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Good idea. Let's get to the exit, everyone!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: What?! This isn't possible...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What is it? Why aren't you moving?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: The exit was right here...but now it's gone!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Maybe it's an illusion. We've seen this kind of thing before...
Gahaha! This is no illusion, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Oh, no...not again...

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Well, it sounds like I've lost the element of surprise. Boohoo.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What are you doing, Iago? Again, we've got you outnumbered.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Oh ho ho! As if I'd grace this battle with my own physical presence. No, there's quite simply no need for me to get my hands dirty...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Then what's your plan? Destroy the fort on top of us? You know it's made out of an indestructible dragon, right?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Well, of course! Why else do you think I chose this location to corner you? The dragon is even more indestructible than you can imagine...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What are you talking about? Everyone, look at the floor! It's...it's covered in some kind of acid!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Bingo, Hoshidan prince/princess! Stomach acid, to be precise. You're about to be dinner for a dragon that hasn't eaten in a VERY long time!

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: He's...he's reviving the dragon somehow! Corrin...I don't think this is mere illusion!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Oh, it's real. Dip your toes in that acid, and you'll see just how real. Compliments of King Garon, of course. He's entrusted me with some rather fabulous new powers. Bwahaha!

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I should have known you wouldn't be capable of something like this on your own.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Ooh...the blue-haired one is being MEAN to me! No matter. I can ignore a minor affront like that...since you're about to die and all.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Dragon or not, these walls can't hold us! Everyone, we just need to break through to the outside. Give me a hand! Hyaaah!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I...I can't make a dent...

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Oh, foolish Corrin... Did you really expect to be able to break through the rib cage of an elder dragon? There's only one way out of here, and I assure you, it isn't pleasant. Also, you'll die. In case that wasn't clear.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What do we do?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Just sit back and enjoy being digested. It's all you can do. Actually, if you're bored, I suppose I can give you a few new friends to play with. Enjoy!

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: GRRRRRAAAH!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Faceless! Watch out, everyone!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: I know—I'm too generous. These lovelies may end up sparing you a wonderfully delicious death by digestion. Either way, I'll be watching from a cozy chair at the palace. Bwahaha!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Damn you, Iago! All right, our weapons and magic do nothing against these walls. What can we do?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Perhaps if I sing...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I don't know, Azura. I don't want you to suffer...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: But my song may be able to break the curse. It could be our only way out!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: But last time... I saw what happened...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Please, Corrin. Don't worry about that. Remember what I told you? I may suffer a little bit, but I'll always be fine. I can deal with a little pain if it means saving all of our lives!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Very well...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: There is just one thing. I'll need you and the others to defeat the Faceless before I begin. My song can be disrupted by the sounds they're making... I'm afraid it won't be powerful enough to break Iago's spell until they're gone.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You can count on us. Just promise that you won't do any permanent damage to yourself, OK?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Yes. I'll be fine. You can trust me.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: All right. Everyone, forget trying to escape. Focus your attention on the Faceless! Let's take 'em down!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Their leader is dead. Azura, now's your chance!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I'll do my best. Ahem...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: You are the ocean's gray waves... ♪

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It's working...the walls are going back to normal. Let's work quickly, now. Hyaaah!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes! We've done it. Everyone, get out while you can! Great work, Azura!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Whew...that was close. Thank you, Azura. We couldn't have done it without you.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: It was nothing. You guys did all the hard work.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Oh, come on. Anyone who can swing a sword can take out some Faceless. But only you could have broken the spell that Iago cast. Now that we're safe...how are you feeling?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I...I'm fine. But let's not linger here too long. Iago said he was able to watch us somehow, so he knows we escaped. We should flee while he's busy apologizing to King Garon.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You're right.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Ohhh...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hmm? Azura?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Are you sure you're feeling well? I thought I heard a whimper...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: You're imagining things. I'm fine. Let's just get moving!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Very well. Come on, everyone. Let's— Wait, Azura...what's happening?!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Please...don't come any closer...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No! Azura! How can I help?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Ngh...ugh...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It's...it's like you're fading away! This is even worse than last time! Azura, please tell me you'll be OK... AZURA!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Gah... *huff* *huff* I...I told you to leave me alone. I'll be fine...eventually.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Azura. It's time you told me the truth about your song.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: There's nothing more to tell. I...I'm feeling better already...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: A moment ago, it looked as though you were literally fading out of existence. Please, tell me the truth. If you truly care about me, be honest. Are you risking your life each time you sing the song?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Azura...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I, um... OK, here's the truth. The stronger an enemy is, the stronger my song must be in order to work. And the more powerful I sing—the more power I draw from my amulet...the more damage I sustain.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: And this damage... What's the worst that could happen?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: It's possible that if I sang long enough, and with enough power... I could disintegrate completely.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What?! But you told me back in Cyrkensia that there was no danger! You said that the song could cause you pain, but never kill you.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I'm so sorry, Corrin. I lied. I knew that telling you the truth would only make you worry. And for the good of us all—and the entire worlds—your focus can't be on me.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I don't know. I don't think you should use your song anymore. I think we're just going to have to figure out a way to get by without it.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Corrin...I really appreciate your concern... Bu the reality is that we can't get by without my song. We can't defeat King Garon without it. The war will just rage on. I want to bring peace to this world. And if I have to sacrifice...so be it. I believe it's my purpose in life...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Please, don't worry. It doesn't mean that I'm destined to die. It only means that I'm willing to give my life for this cause. My dream is to live a long and happy life in a peaceful world. So, believe me...I don't want to go anywhere. I will be cautious.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Trust me, Corrin. I know I lied to you before, but... I won't ever disappear.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I suppose I don't have a choice but to believe you. It's not like I can stop you from using your power anyway. But I expect you to honor your promise. Be mindful of your own well-being!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes. I promise, Corrin.
